review_title: I am a dedicated, versatile, helping professional committed to quality and excellence.
job_title: Substance Use Disorder Intake Coordinator in Chicago, IL
pros: Quality care and small family orientate
cons: South shore hospital has no room for growth.

pros: Small so you get to know staff, Nice size so you cannot get lost, great place for older workers, nice size so you can create a position if you are so inspired
cons: Small so there is not much room for growth, salaries are low

review_title: Conniving nurses that think they are gods
pros: No positive feedback worst working environment
cons: Worst nurses, doctors and security, they will write reports about you from day 1 and treat all non nurses like trash, conspiring to have you fired. Also will report you to management saying you will come to work as an active shooter. Absolutely appalling the OBGYN dept should be shut down.

pros: Staff can be helpful at times.

It is a smaller community hospital so you will have the ability to ask a lot of questions and perhaps learn about more things than you would at a larger hospital. The staff all know each other very well and it is a close knit family environment.
cons: The hospital is poorly managed and the culture of the employees is to do the least amount of work as possible and get paid for it. The supervisors and managers generally have no care for what happens in their departments until there is a health inspection or government inspection coming. Suddenly they are all present and active in "being a manager."

pros: Co-workers are friendly for the most part
cons: Their finances are so bad they can't afford supplies for the hospital. Basic stuff like IV supplies, PPE, etc. It's really bad and very unsafe.

review_title: Unorganized organization from top to bottom
job_title: Unit and Patient Associate in Chicago, IL
pros: Good hard working but unappreciated, underpaid and under-valued staff
cons: Management disconnect from staff members and front line workers are basically non-existant
